HelloWorld.java

This is an example of how to use the OFSM library.

00023 package org.ofsm.examples;
00024 
00025 import java.io.InputStream;
00026 
00027 import org.ofsm.FiniteStateMachineFactory;
00028 import org.ofsm.IFiniteStateMachine;
00029 import org.ofsm.IFiniteStateMachineBuilder;
00030 
00034 public class HelloWorld {
00035     public HelloWorld() {
00036     }
00037 
00038     private void doIt() {
00039         try {
00040             // Creating machine builder
00041             IFiniteStateMachineBuilder bldr = FiniteStateMachineFactory.getInstance().newBuilder();
00042             
00043             // Creating the finite state machine for resource stream
00044             IFiniteStateMachine machine = bldr.getMachine("example.ofsm.xml",getClass().getResourceAsStream("/org/ofsm/examples/example.ofsm.xml"));
00045             
00046             // Get and print inital state
00047             System.out.println("Initial state:"+ machine.getInitialState());
00048             
00049             // Fire the events and print current state
00050             System.out.println("State: "+machine.fireEvent("ReceivedRequest").getName());
00051             System.out.println("State: "+machine.fireEvent("ChargingRequest").getName());
00052             // Fire incorrect (unspecified by model) event and check the currentstate is null (invalid)
00053             System.out.println("State: "+machine.fireEvent("CancelRequest"));
00054             
00055             // Reset the machine
00056             machine.reset();
00057             
00058         }
00059         catch(Exception ex) {
00060             System.err.println(ex);
00061         }
00062     }
00063     
00064     public static void main(String args[]) {
00065         new HelloWorld().doIt();
00066     }
00067 
00068 }
